findings.interpretation: Dayside temperature alone does not uniquely distinguish a bare rock from an atmosphere-bearing case.
A non-zero heat redistribution parameter is favored relative to the no-atmosphere limit.
Energy-balance fits prefer a very dark planet rather than a highly reflective one.

findings.metric: 15 um CO2 spectral band depth estimate
findings.interpretation: Detected spectral structure is consistent with atmospheric absorption near the CO2 band.

findings.metric: Joint fit likelihood ratio (atmosphere vs no atmosphere)
findings.interpretation: Atmosphere-bearing models provide a better joint explanation of phase-curve and spectral data products.

findings.metric: Preferred pressure scale in CO2-rich retrieval family
findings.interpretation: A moderate-pressure CO2-rich atmospheric family remains plausible given current constraints.

controls_or_null_results.statement: A pure no-atmosphere model fails to match both the phase amplitude and the spectral-band behavior at the same time.
O2-rich atmosphere scenarios remain viable and are not excluded by the present observations.
Key inferences are limited by degeneracies among composition, clouds/hazes, and circulation assumptions.
Night-side emission constraints are weaker than day-side constraints in this dataset.
